‘No, he has not made Dounia any presents yet.’ 

Raskolnikov suddenly spoke, surprising his mother. 

‘Oh, yes, my dear.’ 

Pulcheria Alexandrovna exchanged glances with Dounia and Razumihin. 

‘Do you remember, mother, I was in love and wanted to get married?’ 

‘Oh, yes,’ she replied, confused. 

‘She was sickly, an invalid. Fond of giving alms.’ 

He looked down, lost in thought. 

‘She cried when she talked about a nunnery.’ 

‘No, it was not only spring delirium,’ Dounia said warmly. 

He stared at her, not understanding. 

He kissed his mother and sat down. 

‘You love her even now?’ Pulcheria asked, touched. 

‘Her? Now? Oh, yes…’

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov reflects on a past love for a sickly girl, revealing his complex feelings and memories.
